title: Books Fatal to Their Authors
description: 1895. This work discusses literally hundreds of authors and their writings which were fatal to the authors' careers or reputations. The book arranges the various authors in the following topics: theology; fanatics and free thinkers; astrology, alchemy and magic; science and philosophy; history; politics and statesmanship; satire; poetry; drama and romance; booksellers and publishers; some literary martyrs.
author: P.H. Ditchfield
